bibl.title: The petition of Mathilda a free black girl for freedom

div1.p:
The Petition of
Mathilda a free
black girl for
freedom

Filed the 8 April 1815
W Christy Esqire

Territory of Missouri
Country of St Charles

Northern Circuit
in the Circuit Court
April 1815

The petition of Mathida a black free girl about the age of twelve or thirteen now in possession of Isaac Van Bibber Humbly herewith by her attorney To this Honorable the Judge of the said court now in session That your petition was brot from one of the United States long since and before that any act was passed by the Legislature of the Indiana Territory respecting slavery or of indeturing slaves into the said territory by a person by name of Mitchell and your peptioner there remained in said territory whereby she became entitled to her freedom by virtue of an Ordinance of Congress made by Congress for the govern ment of the Northwestern territory and your petitioner being so free of right and by law was afterwards forcibly and against her will taken from said teri tory by a person as well as your peti tioner remembers by the name of John Rector and brot to thistheir territory of Louisiana and sold as a slave to one William Christy and by him detained and
of the by him detained forcibly and against her will in servitude for a long time and your petitioner was afterwards sold or disposed of by said Christy as a slave to one Isaac Van Bibber who has ever since kept her forcibly and aginst her will in servitude as a slave and still detains her in servitude whereas the said Matilda is free and of rights ought to be according to law and your petitioner prays that process may be directed against the said Isaac according to law and that he be compelled to answer thereto and that your petitioner be permitted to sue as a poor person and your petitioners as in duty bound now pray &
